questions.question: What is the chemical formula of the dysprosium phosphonate complex reported?
What structural transition does the dysprosium phosphonate complex undergo upon UV light irradiation?
What is the blocking temperature change for the diluted sample after photo-induced switch?
questions.answer: From 3.8 K for 1Dy@Y to 2.6 K for 2Dy@Y

questions.question: Does the effective energy barrier increase or decrease after the photocycloaddition reaction?
Is the photocycloaddition reaction of anthracene units reversible?
Can the structural transformation from 1Dy to 2Dy be monitored by UV/Vis diffused reflectance and IR spectroscopy?
Does the introduction of a NO3- anion in place of an SCN- anion influence the magnetic anisotropy of the material?
Is the effective energy barrier of 277 K for 1Dy the highest among known photo-responsive Ln-SMMs?
Does the photodimerization of anthracene units lead to a non-reversible structural change?
Is the blocking temperature of 2Dy@Y higher than that of 1Dy@Y?
Does the photocycloaddition reaction result in a decrease in unit cell volume from 1Dy to 2Dy?
Is the magnetic hysteresis loop of 2Dy wider than that of 1Dy?
Can the photo-induced transformation from 2Dy to 1Dy be achieved by 280 nm light?
Does the photoluminescence profile of 2Dy show a decrease in peak intensity at 540 nm compared to 1Dy?
Is the effective energy barrier for spin-reversal of 2Dy@Y reported to be between that of 1Dy and 2Dy?
What is the role of the NO3- anion in the dysprosium phosphonate complex?
questions.answer: It provides three oxygen atoms for hydrogen bonding and influences the magnetic anisotropy.

questions.question: What happens to the effective energy barrier and hysteresis loop upon the structural transition from 1Dy to 2Dy?
questions.answer: The effective energy barrier is reduced by half and the hysteresis loop narrows.

questions.question: Is the photocycloaddition reaction of anthracene units in the dysprosium phosphonate complex a [4+4] reaction?
Does the structural transformation from 1Dy to 2Dy involve a change in space group?
What is the significance of the reported dysprosium phosphonate complex in the context of single-molecule magnets?
questions.answer: It demonstrates a photo-responsive SMM with a high effective energy barrier and reversible structural and magnetic properties.
